__e: - Sir, please. Forgive my appearance, but I really am quite exceptional with numbers.
- Yes. I'm sorry to disturb you, but this party needs your attention.
This is to make you feel better about that... pardon my French, miss, bullshit you pulled.
Doesn't forgive the fact that you weren't honest with me.
Forgive my confusion, but is it not 6:30 here?
I'm sorry. My friend said she met with a woman...
Oh, forgive me, my memory is not what it was.
I'm sorry. My friend said she met with a woman...
So forgive me for noticing but what happened in there?
No need for me to forgive you for that.
"If you don't forgive me for what I did, I'll do it again. "
Not until you pardon her for what she just did.
I have no idea what you're talking about.
And I, God forgive, can't say that it was me who has lived.
May my sister forgive me but she could not have helped.
I don't expect you to forgive me but you'll have to find a way to live with me. Because I'm not going anywhere.
I certainly don't expect him to forgive me but he ought to know that I know that I screwed up.
God forgive me, but you may be a stronger man than your dad was.
You'll forgive me if I no longer trust your word in that.
How can I expect Audrey to forgive me if I'm not willing to do the same?
So forgive me for not going home to have a good night's rest!
And I do hope you'll forgive me for saying you are as lovely now as you were in the movies.
I hope you'll excuse me for saying it, but belief is so often the death of reason.
The girl, she gonna come with us. You gone for bit, you fuckers over on the floor should blood will be on your hands.
"Bless me, father, for I have sinned," is usual.
- "Forgive me Father for I have sinned." - "What have you done my son?"
Bless me, Father, for my dad thinks I've sinned.
"Forgive me Father for what I'm about to do."
Forgive me, father, but I've really nothing to say.
Sorry, father, I did not hear what you asked.
